newsitem.title: FINLAND: VALMET HAS FIM 250 MLN PAPER MACHINE ORDER.
newsitem.headline: VALMET HAS FIM 250 MLN PAPER MACHINE ORDER.

text.p: Finnish paper machine maker Valmet Oy said in a statement on Monday it won an order worth about 250 million markka from Japanese Hokuetsu Paper.
The machine, due for start-up in spring 1998, will have capacity to produce 240,000 tonnes per year of coated wood-based and wood-free paper grades, Valmet said.
Through its license manufacturer Sumitomo Heavy Industries, part of Sumitomo Corp, Valmet said it will be the main supplier of the machine to be built at a plant in Niigata on the island of Honshu.
In 1995, the seven machines at Hokuetsu Paper's Niigata mill produced a total of 518,000 tonnes of paper, 426,000 tonnes of pulp and 48,000 tonnes of paperboard, it said.
